edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image
Class Histogram

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.Histogram
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents a histogram of intensity values in an Image. The bin size is 1 (meaning that intensity values are rounded to integers).

Also calculates statistics like mean intensity, mode intensity, and intensity variance.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Histogram

protected Histogram()

Histogram

public Histogram(Image im)
Constructs a new Histogram for a given Image.

The Histogram will be a snapshot of the current state of the Image, so if the Image changes later, the Histogram will not be updated.

Parameters:
im -
Method Detail

findMaxVal

public static int findMaxVal(Image im)
Finds the maximum value of an image.

The maximum value is defined as the value at the ImageCoordinate whose corresponding Image value is greatest. In particular this makes no discrimination between different dimensions, so will not check just a single color channel, or anything similar.

Does not construct a complete Histogram, so if the only purpose of the Histogram is to calculate the maximum value of an Image, then a bit of time can be saved by using this method instead.

Parameters:
im - The Image whose maximum to find.
Returns:
The maximum value of the Image as an integer.

getCounts

public int getCounts(int value)
Gets the count of how many coordinates in the Image used to construct the Histogram had values that cast to the specified integer value.

Does not check bounds on the supplied value. Ensure that the value passed in is between 0 and the result of getMaxValue(),inclusive.

Parameters:
value - The value whose counts will be retrieved.
Returns:
The number of times the specified value occurred in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

getCumulativeCounts

public int getCumulativeCounts(int value)
Gets the cumulative count of all values in the Image up to the specified value.

The returned value is the same value as would be obtained by summing the values returned from getCounts(int) from 0 to value.

Parameters:
value - The value up to which to count.
Returns:
The number of times and value less than or equal to the specified value occurred in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

getCountsList

public int[] getCountsList()
Gets the entire array of counts at every integer value from 0 to the maximum value in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Do not modify the array that is returned.

Returns:
The array of counts at each value.

getMode

public int getMode()
Gets the positive mode value of the histogram. (That is, the positive value with the highest count.)

This will not return 0 as the mode value unless there are no positive values in the Image used to construct the Histogram, and will never return a negative number.

Returns:
The positive mode value of the histogram.

getCountsAtMode

public int getCountsAtMode()
Gets the number of counts at the positive mode value of the histogram.

If there are no positive values in the Image used to construct the Histogram, this will return 0.

Returns:
The counts at the positive mode of the Histogram, or 0 if there are no positive values.

getMaxValue

public int getMaxValue()
Gets the maximum pixel value in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The maximum pixel value (or if there are no positive values, 0).

getMinValue

public int getMinValue()
Gets the minimum nonnegative pixel value in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The minimum pixel value.

getMinValueNonzero

public int getMinValueNonzero()
Gets the minimum positive pixel value in the Images used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The minimum positive pixel value, or zero only if there are no positive pixels in the Image.

getTotalCounts

public int getTotalCounts()
Gets the total counts of all nonnegative values in the Image.

For Images with no negative values, this should be the same as calling Image.size() on the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The total number of nonnegative values in the Image.

getMean

public double getMean()
Gets the mean of all nonnegative values in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The mean of the nonnegative values.

getVariance

public double getVariance()
Gets the variance of all nonnegative values in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The variance of the nonnegative values.

getMeanNonzero

public double getMeanNonzero()
Gets the mean of all positive values in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The mean of the positive values.

getVarianceNonzero

public double getVarianceNonzero()
Gets the variance of all positive values in the Image used to construct the Histogram.

Returns:
The variance of the positive values.
